title: Adele snaps Grammy Award in half, channels Mean Girls
text:
A dele Adkins is 28 years old. At Sunday's Grammy Awards, she explained that she was 10 when she first saw the video for George Michael's Fast Love , and was "blown away by how how he was". She was a year older when she "fell in love immediately" with Beyonc√©, whom she regretted beating to Album of the Year: "my album of the year was Lemonade, so a part of me died inside". 
But that also means that Adele was the perfect age to enjoy Tina Fey's seminal Mean Girls, which was released in 2004 and made waves as a proto-feminist take on the teen movie, especially at sleepovers hosted by adolescent girls. 
Mean Girls concludes with Cady (Lindsay Lohan in what is arguably her greatest performance) being crowned Spring Fling Queen over Queen Bee Regina George, much to everybody's surprise. When she takes to the stage, she makes a remorseful speech about not being deserving of the honour, before snapping the plastic tiara into several pieces and throwing them to others she admires, including her fellow Spring Fling Queen nominees Gretchen Wieners, Janis Ian and George. 
W hether consciously or merely as a result of plenty of Mean Girls re-runs, Adele re-created the scene with her Album of the Year Grammy award on Sunday. snapping the minature gramophone and raising a bit of it aloft to Beyonc√©, saying: "All us artists adore you. You are our light."
Plenty of people made the connection on Twitter:
